item.title: SessionStorage vs LocalStorage
item.description: Introduction Web Storage is a crucial feature in modern web development that allows websites to store data directly in the user’s browser. The two main mechanisms for this are SessionStorage and LocalStorage. Let’s explore their differences and use cases. Key Differences 1. Data Persistence LocalStorage: Data persists until explicitly cleared Survives browser restarts and OS reboots No automatic expiration SessionStorage: Data persists only for the duration of the browser session Cleared when the browser tab is closed Each tab/window has its own separate storage 2.
